result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua J. Desens

records.addlTxt: Per Judge Huber, hold cash bond posted.
Review hearing on October 1, 2024 at 01:30 pm.

3:56 pm
ADA Kurczewski present in court.
Def. present in court.
Atty. Tom Johnson present in court.
State moves to amend Ct. #1 to 940.19(1) class A misdemeanor battery.
Amended Ct. #1 - NC plea
Ct. #2 - NC plea
Ct. #3 - NC plea
Statements by the Court - court will consider assessing the DOMAB surcharge to Amended Ct. #1 even though no domestic abuse enhancer is requested.
Statements by ADA Kurczewski.
Court questions def.
Court finds def. waives his rights, finds a factual basis exists and finds def. guilty of Amended Ct. #1 940.19(1) class A misdemeanor battery and Ct. #3.
Court finds def. waives his rights, finds a factual basis exists, will accept his plea, but will withhold finding of guilt and places matter into a DPA status for a period of 2 years on Ct. #2.
No written DPA - def. to successfully complete probation and not commit any new crimes.
State is in compliance w/victim notifications.
Recommendations by ADA Kurczewski.
Recommendations by Atty. Johnson.
Atty. Johnson provides letter to the court.
No RHT requested.
re:  Amended Ct. #1 and Ct. #3 - Probation - SW - 2 years - concurrent
Conditions:
1.  pay costs of the action + $100.00 DOMAB surcharge on Amended Ct. #1.
2.  pay supervision fees.
3.  def. to participate in any assessments deemed appropriate by his Agent and follow treatment recommendations arising therefrom.
4.  impose & stayed 60 days co jail - to be utilized by his Agent upon application to the Court - w/WR privileges.
Appeal rights explained to def.
Def. to meet w/P&P - by the close of business on Friday, September 30, 2022.
RH:  10-1-2024 at 1:30 pm 2773
2 days credit, if revoked.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Status conference on July 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
